content.web-title: French president expected to marry former model

fields.field:
The French president, Nicolas Sarkozy, today admitted his relationship with the former model Carla Bruni was "serious" but refused to announce a wedding date.

Appearing at a news conference, the 52-year-old was asked whether he planned to marry Bruni after the Journal du Dimanche (JDD) newspaper reported the couple could get married next month. "It's serious," replied Sarkozy. "It isn't the JDD which will fix the date." He added: "There are strong chances that you'll learn about it when it's already happened."

Sarkozy's admission came as the president slumped to his lowest poll ratings since his election last year.

Only 48% of French voters now trust him, partly because of the country's flagging economy, which he continually promised to address.

The public is also irritated by a "bling-bling" president they see as deliberately playing out his love life like a Hollywood star.

Sarkozy reluctantly divorced his second wife, CÃ©cilia, in October last year and met Bruni just weeks later at a dinner party.

The Italian tyre heiress has previously dated Mick Jagger, Eric Clapton and a former French socialist prime minister. Before appearing in public with Bruni, Sarkozy reportedly commissioned private polls and decided the French would be impressed with his glamorous catch.

Their first public date was to watch the Mickey Mouse parade at Disneyland Paris.

Then they jetted to Egypt for Christmas, borrowing the private jet of one of France's richest tycoons. On the banks of the Nile, the couple posed for the cameras.

Last weekend, Sarkozy led Bruni around one of the main temples in Petra, Jordan, which featured in the Hollywood film Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade.
